meanings.definition: A sudden loud noise like that of thunder.
meanings.sent1: The thunderclap startled the children playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The thunderclap echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected thunderclap made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident was a thunderclap in the quiet town.
meanings.sent5: The thunderclap was so loud it felt like the sky was splitting open.

meanings.definition: A sudden and violent event or action.
meanings.sent1: The sudden thunderclap of the explosion shook the ground.
meanings.sent2: The political scandal was a thunderclap in the community.
meanings.sent3: The thunderclap of the cake dropping on the floor was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The announcement of the merger was a thunderclap in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The thunderclap of the door slamming shut signaled the end of their argument.
